headline: 2025-10-27 — Authors of the arXiv preprint released 1 preprint proposing a generalized interaction variable and demonstrating stability conditions using 2 control methods (FBLC and SMC) with a 1 RLC-circuit example (evidence: text describing interaction variable, FBLC/SMC implementations, and RLC illustration).

2025-10-28 — Springer-hosted paper released 1 holonic multi-agent model for command-and-control (C2) architecture design, describing distributed, intelligent, and diverse self-* properties (evidence: excerpt noting 'a holonic multi-agent model for the C2 architecture design' and characteristics).

2025-10-29 — Authors of a note on IEEE Xplore issued 1 formal correction note addressing 1 'pretty serious mistake' and multiple inaccuracies in the 2007 Proceedings of the IEEE paper by Olfati-Saber, Fax, and Murray (evidence: note text stating correction of a 'pretty serious mistake and some inaccuracies').

2025-10-30 — An arXiv technical note published 1 set of stronger results applicable to networked multi-agent consensus problems and explicitly addressed priority interpretation in the Olfati-Saber et al. framework (evidence: note mentions 'several stronger results' and 'addresses the issue of priority').

2025-10-31 — arXiv paper released 1 interactive energy state-space model that produces an intermediate reactive power control command (evidence: text describing 'interactive energy state-space model to derive intermediate reactive power control' used as command to lower-layer model).

2025-11-01 — ACM-hosted paper published 1 analysis noting that networked multi-agent systems provide redundancy and flexibility and emphasizing design restrictions for such systems (evidence: excerpt 'a multi-agent network provides redundancy' and 'the design of networked multi-agent systems is the restriction ...').
